pr_title: [DOCS] Updating CCR setup to be more tutorial focused

timeline.message: Removing unnecessary links, streamlining content, and adding GIF.

timeline.bodyText:
I'd mention both motivations for CCR (geo location and availability/hot backup). I'd probably drop the first sentence & use the second to lead into a bulleted list.
Also, I think there's a slight SEO advantage to using "how to" instead of explain.

timeline.bodyText:
We've explicitly called out other "tutorial" topics as tutorials & set a short title for the TOC. I normally wouldn't advocate for doing this, but in the current system we don't have another way to tag the content type & there is some SEO advantage to explicitly using the tutorial language.

timeline.bodyText:
Leading with the "on both clusters" makes it harder to scan for requirement.  I think we want to downplay the idea of always using the Elastic super user. Elsewhere, we've focused on the privileges required. (Though somewhat confusingly referred to them as permissions). Whatever we do, we should be consistent. Maybe:


You need the manage and manage_ccr cluster privileges to configure remotes and follower indices on the local cluster.


You need the read_ccr cluster privilege and the read index privilege for the leader index on the remote cluster.


Need to verify those are the correct privs. I'm not sure I'd even add an xref to "Configure user privileges" because if you don't have them, you probably can't configure them yourself. I also think we should assume that security is enabled instead of qualifying it every time we talk about it. We should consider it the default.
